explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA Rule 2.1 applies to unreachable code in the project's translation units (i.e. the code after preprocessing for the chosen build configuration). The code fragment that Agent A refers to is inside the #else /* ! MHD_TCP_CORK_NOPUSH */ branch and therefore is not present in any translation unit when MHD_TCP_CORK_NOPUSH is defined (as you show). Code excluded by conditional compilation is not part of the compiled translation units and therefore is not “unreachable code” under Rule 2.1 for that project configuration. (If you maintain multiple project configurations, you must ensure none of the compiled configurations produce unreachable code; but in the configuration you described there is no Rule 2.1 violation.)
